name: Adobo Puttanesca
description: This Adobo Puttanesca is a unique twist on a classic Italian dish, tailored for those looking for a healthy, high-protein, high-fiber, and high-sodium meal. Perfect for anyone looking to enjoy traditional flavors with a healthified twist.

recipeInstructions.text: Begin by preparing your vegetables. Slice the capsicum, mince the garlic, chop the broccoli, slice the green cabbage, dice the red onion, chop the cauliflower, and slice the carrots.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 1

recipeInstructions.text: Open the package of Shirataki Noodles and rinse them thoroughly under cold water to prepare them for cooking.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pan, heat a bit of oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and diced red onion. Saut√© for about 5 minutes until they start to soften.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: Add the sliced capsicum, broccoli, green cabbage, cauliflower, and carrots to the pan. Cook for another 10 minutes, until the vegetables are tender but still crisp.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 4

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the adobo into bite-sized pieces and add it to the pan together with the Putanesca Sauce. Stir well to combine and heat through, about 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5

recipeInstructions.text: Finally, add the prepared Shirataki Noodles to the pan and toss everything together. Heat everything for an additional 5 minutes to ensure the noodles are heated through.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 6
